thread.title: Local MMA stars prepare for battle in Belfast
thread.title_full: Local MMA stars prepare for battle in Belfast | UTV - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Local MMA stars prepare for battle in Belfast
text:
Fighters at the Bellator 173 & BAMMA 28 press conference on Wednesday. Credit: Presseye By Simon McIntyre Some of Northern Ireland's top MMA stars are preparing for Friday's Bellator/BAMMA event at Belfast's SSE Arena.
Norman Parke tops the bill for BAMMA against Dubliner Paul Redmond. Parke (22-5-1) fights for BAMMA's world lightweight title.
Parke was a former UFC star, now plying his trade with Europe's largest organisation BAMMA.
It marks a first fight in Northern Ireland for over five years for the Bushmills man known as "Stormin' Norman".
Play video Bellator's co-main event sees Strabane's James Gallagher look to continue his undefeated professional career against Israeli Kirill Medvedovsky.
Gallagher (5-0) is under the tutelage of John Kavanagh in Dublin, who also trains UFC superstar Conor McGregor.
The confident 20-year-old says it feels like home in Belfast, and that he can't wait to live up to the hype.
Play video Elsewhere, Andy "Taz" Young fights for BAMMA's interim flyweight world title against the dangerous Dominique Wooding.
Young (10-8) has four wins in his last five fights, including claiming the WWFC world title in his last fight in Ukraine.
After two years on the road, he says he's glad to be fighting at home in front of his family and friends.
Play video Sport Northern Ireland Belfast
